thread.title: Ex-New Orleans cop guilty of obstruction, malfeasance
thread.title_full: Ex-New Orleans cop guilty of obstruction, malfeasance - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Ex-New Orleans cop guilty of obstruction, malfeasance
text:
By KEVIN McGILL
Associated Press NEW ORLEANS (AP) - A former New Orleans police officer has pleaded guilty to malfeasance and obstruction of justice charges in a case related to another officer's shooting death in June.
Court records show that Wardell Johnson pleaded guilty Wednesday. He was freed on $30,000 bond with sentencing set for Jan. 22.
Officer Daryle Holloway was shot and killed by a suspect he was transporting who somehow got a gun into the police car. Johnson was one of the officers who had arrested the suspect, Travis Boys, in an assault case before he was transported.
Police said they uncovered evidence that Johnson disregarded evidence during Boys' assault arrest, failed to adequately pat down Boys and tried to cover up his shoddy work later.
